glsa.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst of which might allow attackers to access sensitive information.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker is able to crash applications linked against OpenSSL or could obtain sensitive private-key information via an attack against the Diffie-Hellman (DH) ciphersuite.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
